content: k1 ssk k to 2 sts before end of continue working in established pattern until round k2tog 4 sts decreased the foot measures 4 cm / 1 5 inches less than desired foot length i recommend ending round 2 k to end of round having worked row 6 or 12 of the cottontail repeat rounds 1 and 2 until you have 20 28 pattern 36 sts left if using contrast yarn for the toes break yarn cut your working yarn leaving a tail of here and start working with your contrast approximately 38 cm 15 inches now you colour now can kitchener stitch your toe closed toe set up round k 28 32 36 pm k to end of round ___________________________________________________________________________ abbreviations bor beginning of round k2tog knit 2 stitches together sm slip marker knit knit repeat sts between brackets the indicated number of times k tbl knit through the back loop sl1 slip 1 st purlwise with yarn at back purl purl sl1 k2tog psso slip next stitch purlwise knit ssk sl1 knitwise sl1 knitwise place both sts 2 together then pass slipped stitch over back on the left needle and k2tog through the back loop p1 k1 p1 in 1 stitch purl knit and purl into the same stitch to make 3 stitches from 1 pm place marker cottontail pattern chart 3 cottontail socks by debbie ford cottontail pattern written instructions row 1 k2 k2tog yo k2 pm p1 k1 p1 in 1 stitch sl1 k2tog psso × 3 pm k2 yo ssk k2 24 sts row 2 4 6 8 10 and 12 k6 sm p12 sm k6 row 3 k1 k2tog yo k3 sm sl1 k2tog psso p1 k1 p1 in 1 stitch × 3 sm k3 yo ssk k1 row 5 k2tog yo k4 sm p1 k1 p1 in 1 stitch sl1 k2tog psso × 3 sm k4 yo ssk row 7 k2 yo ssk k2 sm sl1 k2tog psso p1 k1 p1 in 1 stitch × 3 sm k2 k2tog yo k2 row 9 k3 yo ssk k1 sm p1 k1 p1 in 1 stitch sl1 k2tog psso × 3 sm k1 k2tog yo k3 row 11 k4 yo ssk sm sl1 k2tog psso p1 k1 p1 in 1 stitch × 3 sm k2tog yo k4 i love seeing what you make tag your photos with @daisystitches and use the hashtags #cottontailsocks and #debbieforddesigns this pattern has been tested and tech edited for pattern support you can email me at de88ieford@yahoo co uk 4 cottontail socks by debbie ford
